feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Dense Fog Advisory issued October 09 at 9:56AM AKDT until October 09 at 1:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM AKDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Visibility one quarter mile or less in dense fog. * WHERE...Anchorage and Matanuska Valley. * WHEN...Until 1 PM AKDT this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Hazardous driving conditions due to low visibility.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 09 at 6:30AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snow and Blowing Snow Tonight and Tuesday... East winds of 25 to 35 mph are expected in areas along the Dalton Highway south of Prudhoe Bay. Accumulating snow of 2 to 5 inches will fall late tonight and Tuesday, which when combined with wind will result in periods of blowing snow and reduced visibility. Use caution when traveling.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 09 at 6:30AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snow and Blowing Snow Tuesday... East winds of 30 to 40 mph are expected near and south of Utqiagvik through Tuesday. Accumulating snow of 1 to 3 inches will accompany the winds, with most of it falling on Tuesday. This will result in periods of blowing snow and reduced visibility. Use caution when traveling.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 09 at 6:04AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snow and Blowing Snow Through Tuesday... Snowfall and gusty winds up to 35 mph may lead to blowing snow in the Alaska Range, including along the Parks Highway. An additional 2 to 4 inches of accumulation is expected between Monday afternoon and Tuesday, with the higher totals north of Denali Park.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Northern Denali Borough; Southern Denali Borough

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 09 at 6:04AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Periods of Snow and Blowing Snow Through Tuesday... Snowfall and gusty winds between 25 and 35 mph will result in areas of blowing snow today, with an additional 1 to 3 inches of snowfall accumulation expected through Tuesday. Roads may be slick and will be accompanied with blowing and drifting snow, so expect travel difficulties.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Dalton Highway Summits; South Slopes Of The Central Brooks Range; South Slopes Of The Eastern Brooks Range; Upper Koyukuk Valley; Yukon Flats

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 09 at 5:44AM AKDT until October 10 at 1:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 1 PM AKDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 5 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph will reduce visibility to a half mile or less at times. * WHERE...Eastern Arctic coast from Prudhoe Bay to Kaktovik.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Beaufort Sea Coast; Eastern Beaufort Sea Coast

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 09 at 5:36AM AKDT until October 10 at 6:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 3 inches Monday evening through Tuesday morning. Winds gusting as high as 25 mph. * WHERE...White Mountains and High Terrain South of the Yukon
entry.cap:areaDesc: White Mountains and High Terrain South of the Yukon River

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 09 at 5:36AM AKDT until October 10 at 7:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 7 AM AKDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 08 at 12:29PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH WINDS POSSIBLE FOR THE EASTERN ALEUTIANS THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON... Confidence continues to increase with regards to a strong North Pacific low lifting into the Western Bering Sea by Wednesday. The front will push eastward across the Bering to the Eastern Aleutians by late Wednesday night into early Thursday morning.

entry.title: Wind Advisory issued October 09 at 3:43AM PDT until October 10 at 3:00AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 3 AM PDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...North winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph expected. * WHERE...Santa Barbara County Southwestern Coast and Santa Ynez Mountains Western Range.

entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 09 at 10:11AM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Astor affecting Volusia and Lake Counties. .The Saint Johns River at Astor has fallen from Moderate to Minor Flood Stage. The river is forecast to gradually decline through Minor Flood Stage over the next week. For the St. Johns River...including Astor...Minor flooding is

entry.title: Rip Current Statement issued October 09 at 2:47AM EDT until October 09 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...Coastal Palm Beach County. * WHEN...Through this evening. * IMPACTS...Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 09 at 2:40AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH FIRE DANGER CONDITIONS THIS AFTERNOON INTO THE EVENING FOR PARTS OF NORTHWEST GEORGIA DUE TO STRONG WINDS... Sustained winds of 10 to 15 MPH can be expected along with gusts of 25 MPH. Relative Humidities will likely stay above 25 percent. With dry fuels, high fire danger conditions can be expected. Please refer to your local burn permitting authorities
entry.cap:areaDesc: Bartow; Catoosa; Chattooga; Cherokee; Dade; Fannin; Floyd; Gilmer; Gordon; Haralson; Murray; Pickens; Polk; Walker; Whitfield

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 09 at 2:40AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH FIRE DANGER CONDITIONS THIS AFTERNOON INTO THE EVENING FOR PARTS OF CENTRAL GEORGIA DUE TO LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITIES... Relative Humidities of 25 percent or less can be expected for 4 or more hours |this afternoon into the evening. Winds will be SW at 5 to 10 MPH with gusts up to 15 MPH. With dry fuels, high fire danger conditions can be expected.
